member.name: P:AspMap.Web.ZoomBar.ImagePath
member.summary: Specifies the location of the images used by the zoom bar.
member.remarks:
If the value of this property is empty, the zoom bar control will use default images.
The ImagePath property specifies an optional virtual directory where the images of the zoom bar are stored. The images have hard-coded names, you can find them in the 'install path\IMAGES\ZoomBar' directory of AspMap. The default size of the button images is 18x18 pixels, the size of the zoom level and thumb images is 18x9 pixels. If you change the size of the images, specify a new size using the , , properties.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.MapToolButton.Argument
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument that provides additional information about the property.
member.remarks: Sometimes, multiple MapToolButton controls are related the same tool, such as Point. Use this property to supplement the property with additional information. The value of the Argument property is typically used in tool event handlers ( such as ) to determine the action to perform.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.MapToolButton.MapTool
member.summary: Gets or sets a map tool this tool button represents.

member.name: T:AspMap.Web.MapToolButton
member.summary: Represents a map tool button.

remarks.p: A MapToolButton is associated with a control. Developers should associate a Map control with a MapToolButton by setting it's property.
Set the MapTool property of the MapToolButton control to an appropriate map tool.

The runtime behavior of the MapToolButton is simple. There are two border styles associated with a MapToolButton. The BorderStyle property represents the border of the MapToolButton when it is not selected and the property represents the border of the MapToolButton when it is selected. Initially the MapToolButton appears unselected, but when users click on it, it becomes selected. Then, the current tool of the Map control that the MapToolButton is pointing to becomes active and the appropriate operation on the Map control can be done.

Alternatively, the property can be set to an image that represents the button in its selected state, while The property will represent the normal state of the button (the BorderStyle and properties should be set to None in that case).

member.name: M:AspMap.Data.ShapeDataLayer.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the ShapeDataLayer class.
member.param: Specifes a database provider name. The provider must implement the System.Data.Common.DbProviderFactory class.
Specifes the string used to open a database.
Specifes the table name.
Specifes the name of the shape data field.

member.name: T:AspMap.Data.ShapeDataLayer
member.summary: The ShapeDataLayer class provides access to spatial and attribute data stored in a general-purpose database (such as Access).

remarks.p: This class supports shapes stored in BLOB (binary large object) fields. The internal structure of shapes must conform to the ESRI Shapefile specification.
The property should be specified if attribute data from the database is necessary (for labeling, quering, or editing purposes).

The extent of database layers is not calculated automatically for performance reasons. If you use only database layers in your application, you should set the property before adding the layer to the map.
By default, the extent of database layers is set to (-180,90,180,-90) (units are decimal degrees). The coordinate system is set to WGS 1984 (EPSG/SRID code is 4326).
remarks.note: This class does not support spatial indexes and using it for large databases can affect performance.

member.name: P:AspMap.Data.WkbDataLayer.FieldList
member.summary: Specifies a comma-delimited list of fields that should be returned from the database.

remarks.p: The spatial data field is already included in the list.
If you plan to edit/delete records, the list must include a primary key field.

member.name: T:AspMap.Data.PointDataTableLayer
member.summary: The PointDataTableLayer class provides access to points stored as X/Y (or longitude/latitude) columns in a DataTable.

remarks.p: The database table must contain two columns with X and Y coordinates of points (data type is Double). For example, the points may be stored as longitude/latitude coordinates.
The extent of database layers is not calculated automatically for performance reasons. If you use only database layers in your application, you should set the property.

member.name: T:AspMap.Data.DataTableLayer
member.summary: The DataTableLayer class provides access to spatial data stored in a DataTable.

remarks.p: This class can be used to visualize the result of a custom spatial/attribute query against a spatial database.
The DataTable should contain a column that stores feature geometry that conforms to the Shapefile or OpenGIS WKB format.

The extent of database layers is not calculated automatically for performance reasons. If you use only database layers in your application, you should set the property before adding the layer to the map.
By default, the extent of database layers is set to (-180,90,180,-90) (units are decimal degrees). The coordinate system is set to WGS 1984 (EPSG/SRID code is 4326).

member.name: T:AspMap.Data.SqlServerLayer
member.summary: The SqlServerLayer class provides access to spatial and attribute data stored in a SQL Server database.

remarks.p: This class supports the SQL Server Geography and Geometry data types and spatial indexes.
The property should be specified if attribute data from the database is necessary (for labeling, quering, or editing purposes).

The extent of database layers is not calculated automatically for performance reasons. If you use only database layers in your application, you should set the property before adding the layer to the map.
By default, the extent of database layers is set to (-180,90,180,-90) (units are decimal degrees). The coordinate system is set to WGS 1984 (EPSG/SRID code is 4326).
remarks.note: The Geography type of SQL Server 2008 does not support filter shapes/extents that span more than half of the Earth's surface. SQL Server 2012 is free from this limitation.

The ZoomIn, ZoomOut, Pan, Info, InfoWindow, Center, DrawShape, and EditShape tools can be used when a shape is selected for editing by the EditShape method.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.Cursor
member.summary: Gets or sets the cursor that is displayed when the mouse pointer is over the Map control.

remarks.p: This property specifies the type of cursor to be displayed for the Map control. Values have the following meanings:

dl.dd: The platform-dependent default cursor. Often rendered as an arrow.
The cursor is a pointer that indicates a link.
Indicates something is to be moved.
Help is available for the object under the cursor. Often rendered as a question mark or a balloon.

remarks.p: The full list of all possible cursor types is available at http://www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/ui.html.
If an empty string is specified, the Map control will use default cursor types depending on the currently selected map tool.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.ZoomLevels
member.summary: Returns the ZoomLevels collection associated with the Map.
member.remarks:
Add multiple zoom levels to the collection if you want to enable map navigation by zoom levels only.
If the the collection contains one or more zoom levels, the Map control will adjust the scale of the map changed by the ZoomIn, ZoomOut, ZoomFull, ZoomScale methods and Extent, MapScale properties to the most nearest scale defined in the collection. The P:Web.Map.ZoomLevel property also will be set to the zoom level index that corresponds to that scale.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.MapScale
member.summary: Sets or gets the scale of the map as a representative fraction.
member.remarks: Scale is the relationship between the dimensions of features on a map and the geographic objects they represent on the earth, commonly expressed as a fraction. A map scale of 1:100000 means that one unit of measure on the map equals 100000 of the same units on the earth. The property should be set to the proper map unit before the MapScale property returns and sets meaningful values.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.MapUnit
member.summary: Sets or returns the units for the map.

remarks.p: The MapUnit property must be set to the map unit which was used to create your map layers before the property returns meaningful values. If the property is set, the MapUnit property will be set automatically.
The MapUnit property is set to Degree by default.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.ImageOpacity
member.summary: Returns or sets the opacity of the map image (GIF/PNG).
member.value: A double expression that represents the opacity level. Value must be between 0 and 1.

remarks.p: The value of this property has different meaning depending on the image format:

ul.li: GIF. ImageOpacity of 1 = opaque while ImageOpacity of 0 = transparent. The property of the Map specifies the transparent color.

PNG. ImageOpacity of 1 = opaque while ImageOpacity of 0 = transparent. The BackColor property of the Map specifies the transparent color. If the value is between 0 and 1, the map image will be semi-transparent, while the BackColor property of the Map still specifies the transparent color.
BMP. This format does not support opacity.
JPEG. This format does not support opacity.

remarks.note: Please note that IE 6.0 does not support semi-transparent PNG images.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.EnableSession
member.summary: Indicates whether session state is enabled for the Map.
member.remarks:
When the EnableSession property is True, map layers/collections of the Map will not be disposed and will be persisted between postbacks. This allows you to add layers/collections only once to improve performance of your application.
The EnableSession property must be set to True in the Properties window or in a Page_PreInit event handler.
Always check the property to prevent adding the same layers or collection items again.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.Map.MapTool
member.summary: Gets or sets the current map tool.

member.name: T:AspMap.Web.Map
member.summary: A Map control displays a collection of layers.

remarks.p: With a Map control, you can add and remove layers with the , , and methods. You can change layer order with the method. The property returns the number of layers currently in the map. To access each layer in the collection, use the property. You can zoom in and zoom out features in your map using the and methods.
The map is drawn by exporting the map into an image and this image is used in the IMG HTML tag. The postbacks for map tools are also handled in this control.
A Map control also stores information about the map such as the , , and properties.
You can draw arbitrary geometric features and texts by adding them to the collection. The contents of this collection is persisted between postbacks.
You can mark locations using the collection. The contents of this collection is persisted between postbacks.
You can convert between world and image coordinate system with the and methods.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.SyncRoot
member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to a TileLayer.
member.remarks: While instances of the TileLayer class are thread-safe, initializing a TileLayer is a multi-step process. This property can be used to prevent other threads from accessing the TileLayer before it is fully initialized.

member.name: M:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.GenerateTiles(System.Double,AspMap.Layer,System.String)
member.summary: Generates only the tiles that cover the features of the specified layer.
member.param: Specifies a map scale.

A Layer object. Only the tiles that cover the layer will be generated. If the coordinate system of the layer differs from the coordinate system of the TileLayer, it must be set to the property of the layer.
Specifies an absolute path to a directory to store the tiles.
member.remarks:
The time needed to generate tiles depends on the scale you have chosen and the density of information in the map. Even using a powerful computer, this process can sometimes take days or weeks.
You should set the coordinate system of your map to the property before you call the GenerateTiles method. The coordinate systems of each layer in the TileLayer must be set explicitly or implicitly (via a .prj file).

member.name: M:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.GenerateTiles(System.Double,System.String)
member.summary: Generates a set of tiles in the specified directory.
member.param: Specifies a map scale.
Specifies an absolute path to a directory to store the tiles.
member.remarks:
The time needed to generate tiles depends on the scale you have chosen and the density of information in the map. Even using a powerful computer, this process can sometimes take days or weeks.
You should set the coordinate system of your Map control to the property before you call the GenerateTiles method. The coordinate systems of each layer in the TileLayer must be set explicitly or implicitly (via a .prj file).

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.OffscreenTiles
member.summary: Specifies the number of offscreen tiles (contiguous to the currently displayed tiles) which will be preloaded asynchronously.
member.remarks:
The value of this property is 0 by default.
You may increase the value to improve the user's perception of performance (especially when panning a map).

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.Unit
member.summary: Sets or returns the measure units of the TileLayer.

remarks.p: The Unit property should be set to the unit which is used by all layers added to Tilelayer. If the property is set, the Unit property will be set automatically.
The Unit property is set to Degree by default.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.ImageOpacity
member.summary: Returns or sets the opacity of the tile images (GIF/PNG).
member.value: A double expression that represents the opacity level. Value must be between 0 and 1.

remarks.p: The value of this property has different meaning depending on the image format:

ul.li: GIF. ImageOpacity of 1 = opaque while ImageOpacity of 0 = transparent. The property specifies the transparent color.

PNG. ImageOpacity of 1 = opaque while ImageOpacity of 0 = transparent. The property specifies the transparent color. If the value is between 0 and 1, the map image will be semi-transparent, while the property still specifies the transparent color.
BMP. This format does not support opacity.
JPEG. This format does not support opacity.

member.name: P:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.ImageFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format of the tile images.

member.name: M:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.Initialize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes the TileLayer.

remarks.p: This method must be called after all necessary layers have been added to the TileLayer.
This method lets you specify the number of concurrent tile image requests that can be handled at the same time.

Memory resources required to handle a single request are pre-allocated when the Initialize method is called. Handling each additional request will require an additional amount of memory as for the single request.

An optimal value of the maxRequests parameter depends on the memory available for the application and the number of processors. As a starting point, set it to the number of available processors. The load will be distributed evenly among all the processors.

member.param: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent requests. Valid values are from 1 to 64.

member.name: M:AspMap.Web.TileLayer.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the TileLayer.

remarks.p: This method must be called after all necessary layers have been added to the TileLayer.
This method initialises the TileLayer to handle up to 2 concurrent tile image requests if the number of processors is 2 or more. Otherwise, only one request will be handled at the same time.

member.name: T:AspMap.Web.TileLayer
member.summary: Represents a collection of layers that can be cached to improve the performance of your application.

remarks.p: The TileLayer class lets you define a set of layers that will be rendered at different zoom levels and cached on the client and server side as tile images. AspMap can then distribute these images whenever someone asks for a map. It's much quicker for AspMap to hand out a cached image than to draw the layers each time someone requests them.
The TileLayer class works best with layers that do not change frequently. These include street layers, imagery, and terrain layers.
remarks.note: The TileLayer class does not support rendering of charts ( and adding relations to data sources (.

member.name: T:AspMap.Web.TileCacheMode
member.summary: Defines modes of server-side tile caching.

member.name: F:AspMap.Web.TileCacheMode.Dynamic
member.summary:
The tiles will be obtained from the tile cache directory or generated dynamically and saved into the tile cache directory for further use by other web clients.
This mode also enables automatic removal of tiles if the overall size of the tile cache is more than specified by the property.

member.name: F:AspMap.Web.TileCacheMode.Static
member.summary: The tiles will be obtained from the tile cache directory. The tiles should be pre-generated by using the method.

member.name: F:AspMap.Web.TileCacheMode.NoCache
member.summary: Server-side caching is disabled.

Zoom levels are used to simplify map navigation and feature rendering. Each zoom level represents a map scale. Zoom level indices start with 0 at the smallest scale. The following table demonstrates the relationship between zoom levels and scales:
Map scale Zoom level index Zoom level name
1:1,500,000 0 Country 1:750,000 1 Region 1:250,000 2 State 1:100,000 3 County 1:50,000 4 City

member.summary: Creates a relate between the associated with the Layer and a DataTable object.
member.param: A string expression that evaluates to the name of a field in the associated with the Layer.
An object expression that evaluates to a DataTable object that contains the data to relate to the Layer object's .
A string expression that evaluates to the name of a field in the DataTable.
member.returns: The method returns True on success.

remarks.p: The AddRelate method creates a join between a Layer and a DataTable. The result is a which contains all the records from the Layer, and also new attribute fields from the DataTable. The attribute fields have values if a matching value in the fromField and toField is found.

If a primary key index exists for the toField column in the DataTable, it will be used to speed up search for matching values. Otherwise, a temporary index will be created for the column, or the DataTable.Select method will be used.

member.name: M:AspMap.Layer.GetPixelValue(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Retrieves the red, green, blue (RGB) color value (for 24-bit images) or the palette index (for 8-bit images) of the image pixel at the specified coordinates. This method is for image layers only.
member.param: The X coordinate of a point.
The Y coordinate of a point.
member.remarks:
This method is useful for digital elevation model (DEM), temperature, precipitation maps. When specifying an explicit RGB color, the returned value has the following form (hexadecimal):
0x00bbggrr
The low-order byte contains a value for the relative intensity of red; the second byte contains a value for green; and the third byte contains a value for blue.

member.name: M:AspMap.Layer.SearchExpression(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a Recordset based on a search for all features that meet the criteria in an expression.
member.param:
A string expression that forms the 'where' clause portion of the method. The expression may contain:
1. Any combination of VBScript operators, constants, literal values, functions and field names that evaluates to a value of type Boolean.
2. Or, if the layer is a spatial database layer and the property is true, the expression may contain any combination of SQL operators, constants, literal values, functions and field names that evaluates to a value of type Boolean.

remarks.note: VBScript and SQL expressions use different types of quotes for string literals, VBScript uses double quotes ("), SQL uses single quotes (').

member.name: M:AspMap.Route.MergeSegments(System.String)
member.summary: This method merges road segments that belong to the same street.
member.param: A semicolon-separated list of field names.
member.returns: The method returns True if segments merged successfully.

remarks.p: The purpose of the MergeSegments method is to help you generate driving directions. The method takes a list of field names (from the shapefile associated with the road network) separated by semicolons and merges road segments belonging to the same street:

For example, the code above merges all consecutive road segments that contain "Main" as the street name (the NAME field) and "St" as the street type (the TYPE field) into a street with the "Main St" name. The following pictures demonstrate the effect of the MergeSegments method:
1. Road segments before merging
2. Merged road segments (streets)
After road segments are merged, you can access them as streets using the Streets property. The actual road segments remain unchanged.

member.name: P:AspMap.Route.EnableRestrictions
member.summary: Enables of disables turn restrictions (true by default).

member.name: P:AspMap.Route.TransportationMode
member.summary: Specifies a transportation mode (0 by default).
member.remarks:
The transportation mode is used to filter turn resrictions. For example, suppose the restrictions are defined as follows:
1. from="3081" to="3099" mode="0" 'no turn for all vehicles
2. from="2361" to="8453" mode="0" 'no turn for all vehicles
3. from="2957" to="3091" mode="2" 'no turn for trucks
4. from="5347" to="2367" mode="3" 'no turn for buses
If the TransportationMode is set to 0, the 3 and 4 restrictions will not be used in route calculations. If the TransportationMode is set to 2, the 1, 2 and 3 restrictions will be used.
The values from the enumeration can be used to specify the transportation mode, but any values are accepted (0 is a reserved value).

member.name: P:AspMap.Route.CurrentDate
member.summary: Sets a date and time. If this property is not set, the current local time will be used.
member.remarks:
This property defines the date and time that will be used in route calculations if turn restrictions are enabled for the Route object and if the road network supports turn resrictions.
The Route class uses the day of week, hour and minute values from the DateTime object.

member.summary: Returns a representing the spatial extent of the Route.

member.name: T:AspMap.Route
member.summary: The Route class is used when calculating the distance, drive time, and quickest or shortest route between two or more points.

remarks.para: The Route class is also used when generating turn-by-turn driving directions and highlighting the route on a map. The Route class contains information about each individual turn, such as street name, direction, and distance as well as a binary representation of the route.

Use the method to find a route between any two points. The route is made up of segments that correspond to road segments in the road network. The property returns the total number of road segments in the route. Use the property to obtain information about each road segment.
The property is the distance of the complete route. Use the property to get the estimated time of travel of the complete route in seconds.

The method groups individual road segments into streets to help you generate driving directions. After executing the MergeSegments method, use the property to get the total number of streets and the property to obtain information about each street.

member.name: M:AspMap.TurnRestrictions.BuildIndex(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method builds a turn restrictions index file (.tri) from traffic rules stored in an XML file.
member.param: The path to a shapefile or TAB file.
The name of a field that uniquely identifies records in the map file.
The path to an XML file that contains traffic rules.
The path to the turn restrictions index file (.tri).
member.returns: The method returns the number of successfully processed turn restrictions. The number may be less than the total count of rules in the XML file.
member.remarks: The name of the turn restrictions index file should be the same as the name of the map file, with .tri as the index file extension. This will allow the method to load turn restrictions automatically.

member.name: M:AspMap.Tools.RemoveTempFiles(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: The RemoveTempFiles method can be used to remove temporary files (map images) in any directory.
member.param: A string expression that evaluates to a path to a directory in which temporary files are generated.
Amount of time in minutes.
member.returns: An empty string on success, an error message string if an error occurred.
member.remarks: A temporary file (map image) may be generated every time a user hits a page that contains a map. These temporary files are stored in a directory. The RemoveTempFiles method allows to keep this directory clean. You can specify the directory (usually TEMP in which the temporary files are generated), and amount of time in minutes (e.g. 30 means files older than 30 minutes will be removed). IMPORTANT: For security reasons, the RemoveTempFiles method will remove only files with the 'TEMP_' prefix and '.PNG', '.GIF', '.BMP' or '.JPG' extensions.

The size of the pie chart will be determined by the sum of the values in the chart (for all features within the current map extent). Set MinPieSize and MaxPieSize to the same value to make all pie charts the same size.

member.name: M:AspMap.Recordset.Delete
member.summary: Deletes the current record.

remarks.p: This method supports spatial database layers derived from the .
The database table must have a primary key, otherwise the record will not be deleted.
After deleting the current record, the deleted record remains current until you move to a different record. Retrieving field values from the deleted record generates an error.

member.returns: The method returns a object.

member.name: T:AspMap.Symbol
member.summary: The Symbol class consists of attributes that control how to represent features.

remarks.p: Depending on the kind of feature (layer) you're working with, you can specify the particular style and attributes of the Symbol.

For example, you can specify the interior color and fill pattern of a polygon with the , and properties. The outline color and style of a line are programmable with the and properties. The style of a point is programmable with the , and properties. Line width, point size are controlled with the property.

By setting the to the FillStyle.Bitmap constant, you can use the property to add a bitmap texture as the interior fill pattern of a polygon. Similarly, by setting the to the PointStyle.Bitmap constant, you can use the property to symbolize a point with a custom bitmap symbol.
By setting the property to the PointStyle.Font constant, you can use the property to specify a font of the point. The property is used to specify a particular character code of the font.

member.name: P:AspMap.Font.Charset
member.summary: Gets or sets the character set used in the font.
member.remarks:
The settings for the Charset property are:
0 - standard Windows characters.
1 - default character set.
2 - the symbol character set.
128 - Double-byte character set (DBCS) unique to the Japanese version of Windows.
161 - Greek character set.
162 - Turkish character set.
163 - Vietnamese character set.
177 - Hebrew character set.
178 - Arabic character set.
222 - Thai character set.
238 - East Europe character set.

member.name: T:AspMap.LabelStyle
member.summary: Describes label placement styles.

member.name: F:AspMap.LabelStyle.PolygonCentroid
member.summary: Place a label at the centroid of a polygon. If the centroid is outside of the visible map extent, the label will not be placed.

member.name: F:AspMap.LabelStyle.ShieldLabelShortLines
member.summary: The concatenation of the Shield and LabelShortLines styles.

member.name: F:AspMap.LabelStyle.LabelShortLines
member.summary: This style labels a line segment which length (in pixels) is less than the width of the associated label (in pixels).

member.name: F:AspMap.LabelStyle.Shield
member.summary: Shield style label (line layers only).

member.name: F:AspMap.LabelStyle.PolygonCenter
member.summary: Place a label at the center of the visible part of a polygon if the label does not fit inside the polygon.

member.name: F:AspMap.LabelStyle.Default
member.summary: Labels are placed automatically.
